docs.snippet: To the Editor: Whenever something seems to be going wrong in a particular sector of industry, a host of economic wonder-healers raise the misleading cry of nationalization, as if it were a panacea for all conceivable ills. As could be expected, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Whenever something seems to be going wrong in a particular sector of industry, a host of economic wonder-healers raise the misleading cry of nationalization, as if it were a panacea for all conceivable ills. As could be expected, the American oil companies have now become a favorite target.
docs.abstract: Col James N Ellis lr criticizing suggestion in Donald M Shapiro's Feb 28 article that US test detente in field of strategic arms by unilaterally postponing procurement of certain strategic weapons for limited period

headline.main: Letters to the Editor; Nationalization: How to Create a Monster To the Editor: considered a model of efficiency The Times vs. Ms. Detente: Misread Psyche Straphangers' Worsened Lot On the Fate of a Novelist The Jefferson Nonprecedent U.N.: Misplaced Blame

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay--A year has passed since the Uruguayan armed forces Issued a wide-ranging "program of national reconstruction." Eight months have gone by since the military found that this declaration was not enough and
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay--A year has passed since the Uruguayan armed forces Issued a wide-ranging "program of national reconstruction." Eight months have gone by since the military found that this declaration was not enough and
docs.abstract: article on failure of Uruguayan armed forces to produce 'natl reconstruction' in 8 mos since they instituted joint dictatorship with conservative Pres Juan M Bordaberry; notes most Uruguayans expect mil will soon depose Bordaberry and take absolute power; army officer holds that if mil is to be blamed for nation's condition, it should assume complete power; nation's econ decline revd; crushing of democratic insts, jailing of thousands of pol opponents of Govt and erasure of Tupamaro guerrillas noted; Govt is now fighting 'Marxist erosion' that it alleges is rampant in labor, student, intellectual and theatrical circles; Bordaberry illus (L)

headline.main: Uruguay, in Decline, Awaits Full Military Take-Over; Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Foreign news agencies operating in Uruguay were ordered today to provide the Interior Ministry with copies of all news dispatches transmitted abroad.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign news agencies operating in Uruguay were ordered today to provide the Interior Ministry with copies of all news dispatches transmitted abroad.
docs.abstract: Uruguay Govt on March 13 orders foreign news agencies operating in country to provide interior Ministry with copies of all news dispatches transmitted abroad; Under Sec of Ministry Louis Vargas says measure does not constitute censorship but is merely aimed at learning 'what is said abroad about the situation in Uruguay' (S)

headline.main: Uruguay Demands Copies Of News Agency Dispatches

docs.snippet: Gen. Ernesto Geisel was ceremoniously sworn in as Brazil's new President today amid cautious hopes for some liberalization after a decade of authoritarian military rule.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. Ernesto Geisel was ceremoniously sworn in as Brazil's new President today amid cautious hopes for some liberalization after a decade of authoritarian military rule.
docs.abstract: Gen Ernesto Geisel is sworn in as Brazil's new Pres on March 15 amid cautious hopes for some liberalization after decade of authoritarian mil rule; Bolivian Pres Hugo Banzer Suarez, Uruguayan Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry, Chilean repr Augusto Pinochet, Mrs Richard M Nixon and Papal reprs present; Geisel swears in new cabinet; Gen Vicente de Paulo Dale Coutinho, Defense Min; Mario Henrique Simonsen, Min of Finance; Alysson Paulinelli, agr sector; Antonio Francisco Azeredo da Silveira, Foreign Min; Armando Falcao, Min of Justice; Gen Golbery do Couto e Silva, head of Pres civil household; Sen Nei Braga, Min of Educ; Deputy Arnaldo Prieto, Min of Labor; Celio Borja, leader of Govt party in Cong; Geisel's aides have worked actively to win natl consensus through private meetings with leading critics of regime among press, Catholic ch and intellectuals; results of meetings reptdly is that new Govt will relax censorship, end abuses of civil rights and give Cong new voice; mil rulers face serious econ and soc problems; econ inequalities have widened with heavy dependence on oil imports meaning stringent belt tightening, noting shortages and surge in inflation have sharpened public discontent; illus of Geisel, Medici, John H Crimmins, Pinochet, Bordaberry and Mrs Nixon (M)

headline.main: General Geisel Is Sworn In as President of Brazil As Hopes Rise for Some Political Liberalization; Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Leaders of four military-controlled Latin American countries met here today to consolidate their relations. The meeting took place a day after the inauguration of Brazil's new President,
docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of four military-controlled Latin American countries met here today to consolidate their relations. The meeting took place a day after the inauguration of Brazil's new President,
docs.abstract: leaders of Bolivia, Uruguay, Chile and Brazil meet in Brazil on March 16 after inauguration of Brazil's new Pres Gen Ernesto Geisel; speculation about possible creation of some kind of anti-Communist bloc noted; atmosphere created by new Geisel Govt seems to dispel such suspicions; Brazilian Min Armado Ribeiro Falcao says he will talk with chief critics of govt, leaders of RC Ch, press and intellectuals; illus of Geisel reviewing soldiers after inaugural ceremony (M)

headline.main: Chiefs of 4 Militarv-Backed Regimes Confer in Brazil; Bloc Move Is Denied
Foreign Exchange; Selling Prices, New York Market, commercial rates. Market Averages New Bond Issues

docs.snippet: While emphasizing priority for maintaining the country's spectacular economic development, Brazil's new president, General Ernesto Geisel, has pledged "sincere efforts for gradual but sure progress toward democracy." His two immediate predecessors,...
docs.lead_paragraph: While emphasizing priority for maintaining the country's spectacular economic development, Brazil's new president, General Ernesto Geisel, has pledged "sincere efforts for gradual but sure progress toward democracy." His two immediate predecessors, also generals, made comparable promises only to retreat under pressure into more repressive measures than ever.
docs.abstract: ed on new Brazilian Pres Gen Ernesto Geisel's pol platform lauds Pres efforts for sure progress toward democracy; says one advantage Geisel has is extensive goodwill he commands at outset of 5-yr term; holds Cabinet choices seem to reflect desire to broaden Govts's pol base; lauds Geisel for attempting to end feud with Brazil's RC hierarchy before inauguration; maintains Geisel has opportunity to demonstrate econ progress without repression and buttress

docs.snippet: Spend thy treasure for the cause Of God, and be not cast by thine own hands To ruin; and do Good. Lo! God loveth The beneficent .... They ask thee (O Mohammed!) What shall they spend? Say, whatsoever ye Spend for good must go to parents and near...
docs.lead_paragraph: Spend thy treasure for the cause Of God, and be not cast by thine own hands To ruin; and do Good. Lo! God loveth The beneficent .... They ask thee (O Mohammed!) What shall they spend? Say, whatsoever ye Spend for good must go to parents and near Kindred and orphans and the needy ....
docs.abstract: Edward R F Sheehan article on Persian Gulf states discusses his recent visit to Saudi Arabia, assessing its regime, econ development soc conditions, role of women, religious observance and educ; discusses Saudi King Faisal's character and diplomatic style; notes Saudis plan to spend as much as they can creating welfare state; says Govt is resolved to erect vast indus superstructure that will sustain future generations when eventually oil dwindles by seeking to conclude immense bilateral agreements with various capitalist govts to establish indus complexes in exch for steady supplies of oil; says Govt hopes to spend at least $60-billion over next 6 yrs on welfare, internal development, defense and industrialization; holds Govt will invest much of its wealth in West; illus of Faisal (L)

headline.main: Unradical sheiks who shake the world; Much more wealth than they can cope with Saudi, Arabia: Preserving the Wahabite way Kuwait: No one gets fired Abu Dhabi: Instant development The new Arab: Do we resent him? ' The opulence of oil may produce major political changes in the Arab world. Arab socialism may be doomed.'
